title: >>> PILGRIMS and INDIANS
body_text:
Thanksgiving Special:
WALL v. ALL 4
Don't expect a peaceful feast or memorable family gathering as the picture depicts. This is a war, and yes, there will be casualties. The homeland warriors must defend their territory against a pack of hungry invaders.
Leading the charge for
Team ALL
are Megill, Krott, Butler, DiBuccio, Avakian, Edwards, Stopa, Londono, Tronolone, just to name a few.
But the home turf belongs to
Team WALL
, consisting of some of the meanest, baddest ombres to ever compete; Fitzpatrick, Basista, Pierce, Letsche, Adams, DeCuir, Pellecchia, Kerr, among others.
The feverishly awaited fourth and WALL leads 2 to 1.
You know the story. You've felt the pain.
WALL_VS_ALL 4
is on and it can only happen at DODGEBALL CX3: The Thanksgiving Special.
History Section
Round 1:
DODGEBALL 93
Round 2:
DODGEBALL 97
Round 3:
DODGEBALL CVII
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
The Earnest Eleventh (Part 2)
November: The game's most wild, unpredictable month!
DODGEBALL 62 : 11/04/06
Times had changed, and not for the better either as attendances steadily declined in the few short weeks following the One Year Anniversary event, DODGEBALL 54. This 62nd showdown witnessed a despressing, pathetic 5 competitors, each partaking in a rare
Battle Royal
where it indeed was every man and woman for themself. The tagline was all too appropriate;
The Calm Before the Storm
.
DODGEBALL LX3 : 11/11/06
After months of secrecy, the resurrected clan known as
PondScum
fearlessly invaded the warriors of
EastCoastDodgeball
. The premeditated attack, though unsuccessful, gave way to a vicious Four Team Tournament, with members of the controversial group going head-to-head.
Luke Frazza, owner and operator of Luke's Pizza located directly across the main entrance of Wall High School, delivered his first free pizza at LX3.
DODGEBALL LXIV : 11/18/06
Welcome to the
Dark Days
. In the main event, Kathryn Nogueira defeated Aimee Savoth, securing the first singles shut-out victory in history.
Additional Notes
The
Dark Days
wouldn't conclude until April 2007; Sascha Basista and Joey Smalls debut (LXIV and LXV, respectively).
body_html:
Thanksgiving Special:
WALL v. ALL 4

Don't expect a peaceful feast or memorable family gathering as the picture depicts. This is a war, and yes, there will be casualties. The homeland warriors must defend their territory against a pack of hungry invaders.

Leading the charge for Team ALL are Megill, Krott, Butler, DiBuccio, Avakian, Edwards, Stopa, Londono, Tronolone, just to name a few.

But the home turf belongs to Team WALL, consisting of some of the meanest, baddest ombres to ever compete; Fitzpatrick, Basista, Pierce, Letsche, Adams, DeCuir, Pellecchia, Kerr, among others.

The feverishly awaited fourth and WALL leads 2 to 1.

You know the story. You've felt the pain.

WALL_VS_ALL 4 is on and it can only happen at DODGEBALL CX3: The Thanksgiving Special.

History Section
Round 1: DODGEBALL 93
Round 2: DODGEBALL 97
Round 3: DODGEBALL CVII

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

The Earnest Eleventh (Part 2)
November: The game's most wild, unpredictable month!

DODGEBALL 62 : 11/04/06
Times had changed, and not for the better either as attendances steadily declined in the few short weeks following the One Year Anniversary event, DODGEBALL 54. This 62nd showdown witnessed a despressing, pathetic 5 competitors, each partaking in a rare Battle Royal where it indeed was every man and woman for themself. The tagline was all too appropriate; The Calm Before the Storm.

DODGEBALL LX3 : 11/11/06
After months of secrecy, the resurrected clan known as PondScum fearlessly invaded the warriors of EastCoastDodgeball. The premeditated attack, though unsuccessful, gave way to a vicious Four Team Tournament, with members of the controversial group going head-to-head.

Luke Frazza, owner and operator of Luke's Pizza located directly across the main entrance of Wall High School, delivered his first free pizza at LX3.

DODGEBALL LXIV : 11/18/06
Welcome to the Dark Days. In the main event, Kathryn Nogueira defeated Aimee Savoth, securing the first singles shut-out victory in history.

Additional Notes
The Dark Days wouldn't conclude until April 2007; Sascha Basista and Joey Smalls debut (LXIV and LXV, respectively).
